questions.question: I understand information best when it is presented using diagrams, charts, or videos.
Using color-coding or visual aids helps me organize and recall information.
I learn more effectively when someone explains concepts to me verbally.
Group discussions or talking through ideas help me grasp concepts better.
I prefer to learn by reading detailed instructions or writing notes.
Writing summaries or lists helps me retain new information.
I learn best by doing hands-on activities or experiments.
Practicing real-life examples or physically interacting with materials helps me understand better.

learningStyleTechnique.title: Feynman Technique
learningStyleTechnique.desc: Explain concepts out loud as if teaching someone else.

learningStyleTechnique.title: Visualization
learningStyleTechnique.desc: Mentally imagining concepts helps solidify understanding.

learningStyleTechnique.title: Pomodoro Technique
learningStyleTechnique.desc: Work in short bursts followed by physical breaks.

learningStyleTechnique.title: Mind Mapping
learningStyleTechnique.desc: Create diagrams and flowcharts to connect ideas.

learningStyleCard.title: Auditory Learning

learningStyleCard.title: Visual Learning
learningStyleCard.desc: Learners who prefer to absorb and process information through images, diagrams, charts, and other visual aids.

learningStyleCard.title: Read/Write Learning
learningStyleCard.desc: Learners who prefer to interact with written words and rely on text-based resources to understand and process information.

learningStyleCard.title: Kinesthetic
learningStyleCard.desc: Learners who prefer hands-on, experiential learning and thrive when they can engage physically with the material.
